content.content: GovComms Bi-Weekly Update Nov 29 - Dec 10, 2021  Administrative Update  Holidays Off Our team will be off from December 20th - January 2nd. We will be back on Monday, January 3rd! For any emergency communication needs, @davidutro will remain on-call.  Work Being Done  Stakeholder Alignment and Initiative Tracking at Maker We have begun to schedule Stakeholder Alignment Meetings on the Calls Calendar. The call coordinator will always be listed in the description, so anyone who would like an invite can directly contact that individual on Discord. In addition, an Initiatives, Leads, and Coordination Calls tracker has been created to help align the DAO by maintaining this key information in a single referenceable location. Our first Stakeholder Alignment calls have been around Layer 2, Collateral Management OffChain, Collateral Management OnChain, and Emergency Processes. Each call brings together cross-functional stakeholders to establish initiative-specific milestones and an associated work-breakdown tracking sheet.  Emergency PlayBook Progress Nothing new here. Work on the documentation continues to progress until the completed first draft.  Stakeholder Database We have kicked off our work with the TechGDPR legal firm, starting with a GDPR workshop that trains our team to handle data collection, storage, and processing. We aim to have our processes and documentation fully set up within the first quarter of 2022.  Information Output Audit Thomas completed his meetings with Core Unit Facilitators to capture their feedback on the audit findings, methodology, and practice. To finalize this first round of the audit, expectations and timetables are being discussed for completing recommended actions.  Issue Discussion Calls The next Issue Discussion Call is planned for December 15th.     Issue Discussion #3 | MKR Burn and the Surplus Buffer Governance   [Issue Discussion Call (1)]  To burn, or not to burn: that is the question we’ll be exploring in Issue Discussion #3: MKR Burn and the Surplus Buffer  Join us on Zoom Wednesday, 2021-12-15T17:00:00Z (UTC) as GovComms Engagement Lead @thomas.flitter leads a discussion on the burning of MKR.  From MKR valuation and capital liquidity to growth, risk, and public relations, what drives the sentiment in favor of burning MKR, and on the flip side, when and why should we avoid burning MKR?
